H0.text: Gas is the form of matter in which oxygen is an element.

H1.text: Liquid is the form of matter in which oxygen exists as an element.

H2.text: Solid is the form of matter in which oxygen is an element.

H3.text: Plasma is the form of matter in which oxygen is an element.

A4.text: At standard temperature and pressure, two oxygen atoms will bind covalently to form dioxygen, a colorless and odorless diatomic gas with the chemical formula O2.

A5.text: A metallic phase was discovered in 1990 when solid oxygen is subjected to a pressure of above 96 GPa
